hero.core_tension: Decide whether to pull a headline holiday promotion and portion of planned inventory forward 2–3 weeks to capture early demand (higher immediate ROI) versus holding for traditional timing (risk of end-season markdowns). Visualize the moment of choice and measurement framing—actionable, testable, time-sensitive without literal clocks.
hero.setting: Flagship store planning corner: long studio table near a glazed storefront, polished concrete floor, modular fixture samples stacked nearby
hero.persona: Operator (store operations/merchandise planner) collaborating with studio (visual merchandiser/creative director)
hero.action: Two people lean over a table aligning physical promo mockups, SKU samples, and weekly sell‑through index cards; one gestures forward toward a stacked set of forward-leaning promo cards while the other marks inventory swatches.
hero.urgency_symbol: Symbolic forward motion shown by a compressed-to-stretched sequence of promo cards and staggered product stacks that form a diagonal leading out of frame (implies advancing the window and tracking cadence)
props: weekly sell-through index cards and ROI notecards (paper, no screens)
measuring tape and labeled box stacks
hero.lighting: Polished editorial lighting with confident highlights, crisp key light from upper-left, soft rim to separate subjects, and clean negative space around the table
hero.mood: Precise, collaborative, decisive — anticipatory energy with controlled tension
hero.alt: Two collaborators — a store operations lead and a visual merchandiser — lean over a studio table near a flagship storefront arranging promo mockups, SKU samples and weekly index cards. Polished editorial light creates confident highlights and soft rim separation. A diagonal line of staggered promo cards and product stacks visually implies a forward shift in timing and measurement-focused decision-making.

signal_map.structure: Layered concentric arcs and overlapping lattice of paper tokens (rings for macro windows, inner arcs for short-term plays) — no screens or literal timelines, geometry suggests nested windows and shifting focus
elements: paper tokens and color-coded product tiles (each token represents a signal: S1–S5)
threaded string paths connecting tokens to physical props (pins on a board)
brass pins and translucent overlays to show hypothesis layers
signal_map.motion: Converging flows toward a flagship node and branching micro-flows outward to smaller nodes (implies shifting a single event into a series, testing pilots, or advancing promos); tension shown as compressed arcs that relax into parallel ribbons
signal_map.palette: Matte neutrals (linen, warm grey) with accent retail colors (muted red, deep teal), brushed brass hardware and natural paper textures to keep tactile, editorial feel
signal_map.alt: A tactile signal map composed of layered concentric paper arcs and a lattice of color-coded product tokens connected by threaded strings and brass pins. Converging flows lead to a central flagship node while smaller branches indicate targeted promos and pilots. Polished editorial lighting highlights texture and layered depth.

case_studies.scene: Backroom planning table for advancing headline promos (S1)
case_studies.moment: Operator and studio compare two physical promo mockups side-by-side — one stacked forward-leaning set of cards and one neutral baseline — while sliding weekly sell-through index cards into a visible pile.
case_studies.lighting: Directed editorial key light with gentle fill, confident highlights on hands and cards, negative space around the table
case_studies.alt: Inventory planner and visual merchandiser at a planning table compare a forward-leaning set of promo cards against a baseline mockup, arranging weekly sell-through cards and sample SKUs under polished editorial light to emphasize a decision about timing and measurement.

case_studies.scene: Flagship storefront prep for parade-weekend experience (S2)
case_studies.moment: A studio lead pins an exclusive product to a staged podium while the operator tightens a short cordon; clustered product and a tightened display imply a timed, limited window without showing clocks.
case_studies.persona: Store events lead + creative studio producer
case_studies.lighting: High-contrast editorial front light on the podium, soft ambient fill in the window, clean negative margins
case_studies.alt: A studio producer pins an exclusive product to a podium while a store events lead adjusts a short cordon, staged at a flagship window. Polished editorial lighting and clean negative space convey a timed, high-impact in-store experience geared toward parade‑weekend footfall.

case_studies.moment: Operator sorts SKUs into a series of smaller bundle stacks, each wrapped differently and arranged as a stepped sequence to represent a multi-week targeted promo series versus a single deep markdown.
case_studies.lighting: Polished overhead editorial wash with side highlights to emphasize texture of packaging, clear negative space separating stacks
case_studies.alt: A merchandise operations manager and creative lead sort SKUs into stepped bundles with color-coded wraps and price-tag mockups under polished overhead editorial light, visually suggesting a series of targeted promos replacing a single deep-markdown event.

case_studies.scene: Co-branded pop-up fixture planning in a high-footfall neighborhood (S4)
case_studies.moment: Operator and studio attach co-branded collateral to modular wall panels and arrange a compact capture station for mailing-list cards and social engagement tokens; spatial compression signals a short-duration pop-up test.
case_studies.persona: Retail partnerships manager + brand studio lead
case_studies.lighting: Directional window-back editorial light with warm fill and crisp highlights on printed collateral
case_studies.alt: A retail partnerships manager and brand studio lead fit co-branded collateral on modular wall panels and arrange a capture station with mailing-list clipboards and social tokens. Window-back editorial lighting emphasizes the pop-up's compact, test-oriented layout.

case_studies.scene: AI-driven allocation pilot setup in flagship back-of-house (S5)
case_studies.moment: Operator and data-savvy studio member align a translucent allocation overlay over physical bins; colored pegs and printed margin tags show suggested reallocation and expected clearance reduction without showing device screens.
props: labeled physical bins with colored pegs
clearance SKU samples and margin tags
case_studies.lighting: Controlled editorial key light with subtle backlight to emphasize translucent overlays and peg textures, clean negative space
case_studies.alt: An operations lead and studio data producer align a translucent allocation overlay over physical bins, placing colored pegs and margin tags to represent AI-driven reallocation suggestions. Polished editorial light highlights the overlay while maintaining a tactile, non-digital feel.
